content: uk for more unwind knitwear patterns please visit our ravelry pattern page join in the chat news and kals on unwind knitwear s ravelry group follow along via our instagram account at unwind_knitwear appendix back lengthening i recommend trying on your garment before separating for body and sleeves if the back is sitting higher than the front you can add length to the back as follows set up k to marker sm k sleeve sts to marker sm k1 m1l k to 1 st before marker m1r k1 rm sl 52 54 57 59 62 64 69 70 76 76 sleeve sts to scrap yarn rm turn to ws r1 ws p1 m1rp p to 1 st before marker m1lp p1 rm sl 52 54 57 59 62 64 69 70 76 76 sleeve sts to scrap yarn rm turn to rs r2 rs k1 m1l k to 1 st before marker m1r k1 turn to ws r3 ws p1 m1rp p to 1 st before marker m1lp p1 turn to rs r4-5 work r2-3 once more r6 rs k to end of back piece turn to ws and use the cable co method to co 1 2 4 8 13 19 18 22 23 27 underarm sts turn to rs and k to end of front piece turn to ws and use the cable co method to co 1 2 4 8 13 19 18 22 23 27 underarm sts pm for bor at approximate centre of co underarm sts body st count 168 196 208 224 244 268 288 304 324 344 sts once complete return to body p 6 to continue working 8
